title: Indian in space: A 41-year wait that wonâ€™t repeat
content: After a 41-year gap, India celebrates Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla as its second astronaut, following Rakesh Sharma's 1984 mission. Shukla's flight signifies India's growing ambition in space exploration, closely tied to the Gaganyaan program. ISRO is developing indigenous technologies for crew safety and astronaut training, aiming for self-reliance in future missions.

title: â€˜100% communist lunaticâ€™: Trump slams Zohran Mamdani after NYC primary win
content: Donald Trump criticized Zohran Mamdani, labeling him a "100% Communist Lunatic" after his apparent mayoral primary win against Andrew Cuomo. Trump's post on Truth Social also targeted Chuck Schumer with false claims. Republicans are attempting to portray Mamdani as representative of the Democratic party, while some conservatives are attacking his faith.

title: US sate secy Marco Rubio says Iran 'much further away from nukes' after strikes
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated that Iran's nuclear weapons program is significantly set back following recent US airstrikes, contradicting reports suggesting minimal impact. While President Trump hinted at regime change, Rubio clarified the US aims to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons, viewing regime change as a potential consequence of Iran's current trajectory.

title: Americaâ€™s China threat: Huaweiâ€™s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions; What experts are saying
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: Trump claims Israeli agents inspected Iran site, saw 'total obliteration'
content: Following US airstrikes on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, President Trump claimed Israel might have inspected the damage, asserting "total obliteration." Despite a leaked report suggesting minimal setbacks to Iran's nuclear program, Trump insisted the strikes caused decades of delay. He warned of further action if uranium enrichment resumes, drawing a controversial comparison to the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: Dwyane Wadeâ€™s wife Gabrielle Union opens up about financial pressures
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Accenture sees highest-ever quarterly drop in headcount, as numbers fall by ...
content: Accenture's Q3 FY25 saw an 8% revenue increase, reaching $7.7 billion, fueled by AI service demand. Despite a gross margin dip and workforce reduction, the company raised its revenue growth forecast. Generative AI bookings surged, contributing significantly to overall revenue, with the Americas leading regional performance. The company projects strong Q4 revenues, emphasizing its role as a reinvention partner.

title: The new CBSE Class 10 board exam system and how it will work from 2026 - Explained
content: Starting in 2026, CBSE will implement a biannual Class 10 board exam system, offering students two chances each academic yearâ€”one mandatory and one optional for improvement. As per NEP-2020, the move aims to reduce exam stress and increase flexibility. Students may improve up to three subjects, and only the best score will be retained. The policy includes specific rules for special categories, result handling, and provisional Class XI admission based on first exam results.

title: Amazon employees to CEO: 'Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than...'
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: Taylor Swift crashes Kane Brownâ€™s big moment with bold surprise at TEU concert
content: Kane Brown headlined the Tight End University concert in Nashville, thinking he was the main attraction. However, the crowd erupted when Taylor Swift unexpectedly joined him on stage, creating a viral moment. The surprise appearance, confirmed by the NFL and TEU, delighted fans and players alike, overshadowing Brown's performance and becoming the event's highlight.

title: After English, a lesson in French: Shashi Tharoor slams Pakistan in Russia -watch
content: Shashi Tharoor garnered acclaim for his fluent French while challenging Pakistan's inclusion in a Russian-led anti-terrorism conference. During a meeting with Leonid Slutsky in Moscow, Tharoor highlighted Pakistan's role as a safe haven for terrorist groups, emphasizing their training, funding, and arming of terrorists. His remarks, delivered in French, quickly went viral, praised for both linguistic skill and diplomatic clarity.

title: Not Kohli! Rohit credits this player for T20 World Cup triumph: 'That knock was a game changer'
content: Rohit Sharma lauded Axar Patel and Virat Kohli's pivotal contributions in India's T20 World Cup victory over South Africa, marking their first ICC title since 2013. Axar's crucial 47 off 31 balls and his partnership with Kohli steadied India's innings. Kohli's anchoring 76 earned him Player of the Match, while Bumrah and Arshdeep sealed the win in a tense final.

title: â€˜Just praise him a littleâ€™: Trump repeats mediation claim; Congress taunts PM Modi again
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi following Donald Trump's renewed claim of halting a war between India and Pakistan using trade leverage. Congress leader Pawan Khera accused Modi of potentially compromising India's interests for praise. Trump asserted he intervened through phone calls, linking trade deals to de-escalation.

title: 'Daddy used strong words': Trump likens Iran-Israel clash to schoolyard fight
content: During a NATO summit, Mark Rutte jokingly called Donald Trump "daddy" after Trump likened the Iran-Israel conflict to a schoolyard fight. This exchange followed a US airstrike, Operation Midnight Hammer, which targeted Iranian nuclear facilities. The operation involved numerous aircraft and precision-guided weapons, including bunker-buster bombs, aimed at crippling Iran's uranium enrichment program.

title: Zohran Mamdani: Indian-American shakes up Democratic Party - future or fluke?
content: Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist, has taken a surprising lead in New York City's mayoral primary, prompting Andrew Cuomo to concede. This race highlights the Democratic Party's internal divisions and signals the rise of its progressive wing. Mamdani's focus on affordability and grassroots campaigning resonated with young voters, but his socialist views could face challenges in the general election.

title: Mitch Marner in Vegas, couple house-hunting sparks NHL trade buzz
content: As NHL free agency nears, speculation about Mitch Marnerâ€™s future intensifies. A new report claims Marner and his wife, Stephanie Marner were seen looking at homes in Las Vegas, adding fuel to the rumors. With cap-space moves and trade whispers surrounding the Golden Knights, the possibility of a Vegas relocation is gaining momentum.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir refuses to laud Pant's twin tons after loss â€“ 'There were ...'
content: Following India's shocking Test defeat against England, head coach Gautam Gambhir downplayed individual achievements, despite centuries from Rishabh Pant and others. He emphasised the team's failure to defend a massive score, highlighting England's record chase led by Ben Duckett. Fast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from the squad as injury concerns eased.

title: 'I made some wrong friends, lost focus on cricket': Prithvi Shaw
content: Prithvi Shaw, once hailed as a future star, candidly admits to making poor choices and losing focus on cricket, leading to a decline in his career. After being dropped due to fitness issues and going unsold in the IPL, Shaw seeks a fresh start by leaving the Mumbai Cricket Association to play for Maharashtra.

title: China bridge collapse: Truck hangs mid-air with driver inside - watch
content: A cargo truck in China's Guizhou province precariously dangled from a collapsed highway bridge after a landslide triggered by torrential rains. The incident, captured on video and shared by Reuters, shows the truck's cabin hanging mid-air. Driver You Guochun recounted the terrifying moment, stating the bridge vanished before him. Emergency services swiftly rescued the driver, with no injuries reported.

title: IND vs ENG: India fast bowler released from squad ahead of 2nd Test in Birmingham
content: India's Harshit Rana has been released from the Test squad before the second match against England. This decision follows after India's loss at Headingley, despite their impressive 835 runs and five centuries. England's remarkable chase of 371, led by Ben Duckett's 149, secured a five-wicket victory. India aims to level the series in the upcoming Edgbaston Test on July 2.

title: Point of no return? Kharge takes 'Modi first' swipe; Tharoor responds with cryptic post
content: The ongoing tension between Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor escalated when Kharge criticized Tharoor's praise of PM Modi, implying a 'Modi first, country later' approach. This followed Tharoor's article highlighting Modi's global engagement as a prime asset for India.

title: India laps up discounted crude: RIL gets big chunk of Russia oil exports
content: India has become the primary destination for Russian Urals crude oil in 2025, with private refiners Reliance and Nayara significantly increasing their purchases. Reliance has secured a long-term contract, making Urals a substantial portion of their total crude acquisitions.

title: Massive! Sachin Tendulkar reveals life-changing moment: 'I was just 10 when ...'
content: On June 25, 1983, Kapil Dev's India achieved an improbable victory against the West Indies, securing their first ICC World Cup. This historic win at Lord's dramatically altered India's cricketing trajectory, inspiring a generation, including a young Sachin Tendulkar. The veteran shared a touching account of the same on his X handle.

title: Trumpâ€™s Iran gambit: Why Xi Jinping stayed quiet - what it means for Taiwan
content: June 2025 marked a pivotal moment when US President Trump launched airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear sites, prompting a surprisingly muted reaction from China that intrigued international observers. Although China publicly denounced the strikes as illegal under international law, it chose not to escalate tensions through significant diplomatic means or military posturing.

title: Killed by TTP: Pakistan major who captured Abhinandan dies; Munir attends funeral
content: A Pakistan military officer, Major Syed Moiz Abbas Shah, who claimed to have captured Indian Air Force pilot Abhinandan Varthaman in 2019, has been killed in a clash with Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants near the Afghan border. The Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) reported that Major Shah died alongside Lance Naik Jibran Ullah during an operation in South Waziristan.

title: Punjab: After Meerut drum murder case, man's body found in a blue drum in Ludhiana
content: A dead body was discovered in a blue drum in Ludhiana's Sherpur area. The victim's limbs were tied. Rag pickers found the drum and alerted the police due to a foul smell. Police investigation revealed the body was wrapped in a bedsheet inside a gunny bag. The victim is estimated to be around 40 years old.

title: â€˜Some of his shots probably werenâ€™t ...â€™: Chappell sends Pant honest feedback
content: Greg Chappell lauded Rishabh Pant's explosive batting in the recent Test match against England, comparing his game-changing impact to that of former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist. Pant's twin centuries at Headingley, a feat matched only by Andy Flower previously, showcased his fearless approach and ability to keep bowlers on their toes.

title: 'Badly damagedâ€™: In a first, Iran admits impact on nuclear sites in US strikes
content: Iran has acknowledged that recent US strikes caused significant damage to its nuclear installations. This admission follows President Trump's claims that the strikes "obliterated" Iran's nuclear program. Trump asserted that Iran's nuclear ambitions have been significantly delayed, drawing a controversial parallel to the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: Income Tax Return: What is Form 16? Check this before filing ITR
content: ITR filing: Form 16, a crucial document for salaried taxpayers, is issued by employers, detailing TDS on salary. It contains vital information like employer/employee details, income earned, and deductions.

title: NBA Trade Rumors: LA Lakers reportedly eyeing $13,372,418 Utah Jazz star to join LeBron James and Luka Doncic to add power to the squad
content: The Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly showing significant interest in acquiring Utah Jazz center Walker Kessler and are willing to offer multiple draft picks. Despite Utah's rebuild and Kessler's potential trade value, they haven't shown a strong inclination to trade him. Several teams are interested in Kessler due to his defensive prowess and offensive growth.

title: Moscow airport: Man flips, slams Iranian toddler on floor; child in coma
content: In a horrifying incident at a Moscow airport, a man from Belarus violently attacked an 18-month-old boy, causing severe injuries. The child, who had recently arrived from Iran with his pregnant mother, is now in a coma. Authorities detained the suspect, Vladimir Vitkov, and found evidence of drug use, investigating the motive behind the brutal assault.

title: Socialist PIO Mamdani on track to become NYC Mayor, shocking US establishment
content: Zohran Mamdani, an Indian-American, is likely to become New York City's next mayor. He defeated Andrew Cuomo in the primary. Mamdani, a Democratic Socialist, may become the city's first Muslim and Indian-American mayor. His campaign focused on populist ideas. He received support from Bernie Sanders and Alexandra Ocasio-Cortez.

title: Where to watch the 2025 NBA draft- Date, time, streaming details and more
content: Basketball enthusiasts eagerly anticipate the 2025 NBA Draft, a two-day event commencing on June 25th at 8 p.m. ET. The draft, broadcast on ESPN and ABC from Barclays Center, will unveil the next generation of stars, including Duke's Cooper Flagg. The draft lottery, overseen by Ernst & Young, determines the coveted No.

content: Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi is Major League Soccer's highest-paid player for the second year running, with a total guaranteed compensation of $20.45 million, according to data released by the MLS Players Association.

content: Manchester United are closing in on a deal for Bryan Mbeumo after a breakthrough in talks with Brentford, sources have told ESPN.

title: "They Need Money": Trump Signals US May Ease Iran Oil Sanction
content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the U.S. has not given up its maximum pressure on Iran - including restrictions on sales of Iranian oil - but signaled a potential easing in enforcement to help the country rebuild.

title: Trump Repeats Claim Of US "Obliterated" Iran Nuclear Sites
content: US President Donald Trump has once again asserted his claims on Washington "obliterating" Iranian nuclear sites during its targeted strikes on June 22, riding on Israel's assessment made by the Israel Atomic Energy Commission (IAEC) on those sites.

title: BJP Protests At Tripura Congress MLA Residence Over "Urinate" Remarks
content: A group of BJP activists stormed the premises of the MLA hostel in Radhanagar area in Agartala on Wednesday over the Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman's controversial remarks against Tribal community.

title: "Very Close": Trump Hints At Gaza Ceasefire After Israel-Iran Truce
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that progress was being made to end the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, as a new ceasefire push began more than 20 months since the start of the conflict.

title: Iran Partially Reopens Airspace After Ceasefire With Israel
content: Iran on Wednesday reopened the airspace over the country's east, state media reported, following a ceasefire with Israel that ended 12 days of fighting.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping To Skip BRICS Summit In Brazil: Report
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping plans to skip the BRICS Summit in Brazil next month, which, if confirmed, will be his first-ever absence from the meeting of the grouping of emerging economies since taking office 12 years ago, according to media reports.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom 4 Mission Creates History For 3 Countries
content: The Axiom 4 launch, a commercial human spaceflight mission involving Axiom Space, NASA, and SpaceX, has scripted history in more ways than one.

title: Israel Thanks US' CIA For Help In "Joint" Operation Against Iran War
content: The head of Israel's Mossad intelligence service thanked the US Central Intelligence Agency on Wednesday for its help in "joint" operations during the recent 12-day war with Iran.

title: World Bank Approves $426 Million For Bengaluru Water Security Project
content: The World Bank has sanctioned USD 426 million for a new initiative to enhance water security for over four million residents in Bengaluru, officials said.

title: 13-Year-Old Specially-Abled Boy Dies In Suicide Bid By Father In UP: Cops
content: A 13-year-old boy with physical and mental impairments died while his father was critically injured after they jumped into Saryu river here in an alleged suicide bid on Wednesday evening, police said.

title: Amazon Tycoon Jeff Bezos, Fiancee Lauren Sanchez Arrive In Venice For Lavish Wedding
content: Amazon's billionaire founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancee Lauren Sanchez arrived in Venice on Wednesday ahead of their wedding, an event that has sparked protests in the Italian city.

content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday his closely watched meeting in The Hague with Ukraine's leader Volodymyr Zelensky "couldn't have been nicer".

content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday said he had discussedbuying US air-defence systems with President Donald Trump during their meeting on the sidelines of NATO's summit in The Hague.

content: A man has been arrested from the Navy's headquarters in Delhi and accused of spying for the Pakistani Intelligence agency ISI.

content: British oil major Shell said Wednesday it was not in talks with BP to acquire its rival, after the Wall Street Journal reported there had been preliminary discussions.

title: How South Korea's Dog Meat Ban Leaves Farmers And 500,000 Dogs In Limbo
content: The government claims local authorities will take surrendered dogs into shelters. But rehoming is proving difficult. Farms raised large breeds like Tosa-Inu for meat, dogs often labeled "dangerous" under South Korean law.
